definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: So Naaman went with his horses and chariots and stopped at the door of Elisha's house.
sentences.chinese: 于是，乃缦带着车马到了以利沙的家，站在门前。

sentences.english: So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariot， and stood at the door of the house of Elisha.
sentences.chinese: 于是，乃缦带着车马到了以利沙的家，站在门前。

sentences.english: Chariot horses and implements were first discovered during excavation at Yinxu in 1931.
sentences.chinese: 车马器实物是1931年在殷墟考古中首次发现的。

sentences.english: At present, excavated Shang period chariot pits number more than 40.
sentences.chinese: 截止目前，发掘出土的殷代车马坑超过40座。

sentences.english: Two "Bronze Chariot and Horse" sculptures were unearthed in 1980 among the terracotta soldiers in Xi'an, the capital city of Shaanxi Province.
sentences.chinese: 1980年，两件青铜车马雕塑在陕西省会西安出土。

sentences.english: When the servant of the man of God got up and went out early the next morning, an army with horses and chariots had surrounded the city.
sentences.chinese: 神人的仆人清早起来出去，看见车马军兵围困了城。

sentences.english: The noise of traffic kept him awake all the night .
sentences.chinese: 车马行人的喧嚣声搅得他通宵不能入睡。

sentences.english: It is also about the only time each year that Beijing's wild traffic is tamed for a few days.
sentences.chinese: 这大概也是北京每年唯一一次远离车马喧嚣的日子。

sentences.english: Then he sent horses and chariots and a strong force there. They went by night and surrounded the city.
sentences.chinese: 王就打发车马和大军往那里去，夜间到了，围困那城。

sentences.english: Therefore sent he thither horses, and chariots, and a great host: and they came by night, and compassed the city about.
sentences.chinese: 王就打发车马和大军往那里去，夜间到了，围困那城。

sentences.english: Din din outside, traveling, voice shouted.
sentences.chinese: 外面车马喧喧，人声嚷嚷。

definition: businessmen and travelers/traveling merchant/(Tw) business hotel
magnificent carriage and precious horses (idiom); rich family with extravagant lifestyle/ostentatious display of luxury
